page.title: 14Farming around Oakley
page.content: Oakley has mostly Jacob sheep they have black faces.The sheep are kept for their meat (mutton or lamb )and wool.Dairy farming is important in Oakley.The cows are milked by machine and it is done indoors.While being milked the cows have some extra food so that they give more milk.Milkis some times made into butter,cream and cheese.The cows are milked twice a day in the morning, and in the afternoon.Our local farms grow wheat barley,rape and corn. Britain's biggest grain crop is barley.Best quality barley is used for making beer but the bulk of the crop is made into animal food,especially for young beef cattle.The wheat goes to make flour for humans.Britain grows just over half of the wheat that the country needs.
